name: MS-M2-Readiness-Summary.md
description: **Status**: ✅ Ready to proceed with verification and hardening - **Evidence**: M1 indexing provides O(1) lookup via `_index_by_schema` and `_index_by_role` - **Implementation**: Conflict detection uses `_index_by_schema. get(schema_id)` rather than scanning `_claims` - **Evidence**: MS-03 provides `TemporalScope` with `overlaps()` method - **Implementation**: Can ask "Are these two claims about the same thing, at overlapping times. " - **Evidence**: Three orthogonal axes: - `epistemic_status`: asserted vs hypothesis - `modal_scope`: ACTUAL / HYPOTHETICAL / COUNTERFACTUAL - **Implementation**: Can distinguish epistemic disagreement from modal disagreement - **Evidence**: Guardrails in place:.
recommendation: Keep in archive - historical reference only
title: M2 Conflict Sets — Readiness Summary
synopsis: **Status**: ✅ Ready to proceed with verification and hardening - **Evidence**: M1 indexing provides O(1) lookup via `_index_by_schema` and `_index_by_role` - **Implementation**: Conflict detection uses `_index_by_schema. get(schema_id)` rather than scanning `_claims` - **Evidence**: MS-03 provides `TemporalScope` with `overlaps()` method - **Implementation**: Can ask "Are these two claims about the same thing, at overlapping times. " - **Evidence**: Three orthogonal axes: - `epistemic_status`: asserted vs hypothesis - `modal_scope`: ACTUAL / HYPOTHETICAL / COUNTERFACTUAL - **Implementation**: Can distinguish epistemic disagreement from modal disagreement - **Evidence**: Guardrails in place:.

name: MS-M4-M5-Phase6D-Plan.md
description: - `verified=True` means cryptographically/content-addressably consistent under chosen mode - **Same requirements for both STRICT and SALVAGE**: `REPLAYABLE` + no errors - Mode provenance tracked via `verifier_mode` + `recovery_used` flags - **Gating check**: Must have `>= REPLAYED` to proceed to Phase 6C - **Final verdict**: Must have `== REPLAYABLE` for `verified=True` - Two distinct checks: `check_can_verify_report()` and `check_final_verdict_requirements()` - Certificate is entrypoint (no pre-known hash) - New loader: `load_certificate_by_path()` computes hash from bytes - Verification rule: computed byte-hash must equal `certificate. content_hash` - Phase 6D loads certificate, manifest, and report once.
recommendation: Keep in archive - historical reference only
title: M4-M5 Phase 6D Planning: Main Verification Engine
synopsis: - `verified=True` means cryptographically/content-addressably consistent under chosen mode - **Same requirements for both STRICT and SALVAGE**: `REPLAYABLE` + no errors - Mode provenance tracked via `verifier_mode` + `recovery_used` flags - **Gating check**: Must have `>= REPLAYED` to proceed to Phase 6C - **Final verdict**: Must have `== REPLAYABLE` for `verified=True` - Two distinct checks: `check_can_verify_report()` and `check_final_verdict_requirements()` - Certificate is entrypoint (no pre-known hash) - New loader: `load_certificate_by_path()` computes hash from bytes - Verification rule: computed byte-hash must equal `certificate. content_hash` - Phase 6D loads certificate, manifest, and report once.

Evidence weighting applies non-negative weights to episodes based on OutcomeWitness, affecting hypothesis ranking without changing legality. - Weight episodes, not observations (v0) - Non-negative weights only (failures downweighted, not inverted) - Monotone coverage scoring (bounded [0,1]) - Applied at scoring time, not collection time - Counterfactual stability test with hard/soft invariants **File**: `core/induction/evidence_weighting.
recommendation: Keep in archive - historical reference only

synopsis: Implemented evidence weighting v0 with tightened invariants and proper governance. name: generative-inversion.md
description: Sterling is a semantic-first cognitive architecture designed to operate across both interactive and autonomous reasoning environments. Unlike autoregressive language models (LLMs) that intertwine syntax, semantics, and sequential prediction into a token-by-token generation pipeline, Sterling begins with symbolic, typed intermediate representations (IR) that encode deep structure, inference logic, and propositional semantics. This document formalizes a generative hypothesis: that diffusion-based language generation, especially when conditioned on semantic graphs, is better aligned with Sterling's architecture than traditional autoregressive decoding.
recommendation: Active development - no action needed
title: Sterling's Generative Inversion of Psycholinguistic Models: A Diffusion-Based Semantic Realization Architecture
synopsis: Sterling is a semantic-first cognitive architecture designed to operate across both interactive and autonomous reasoning environments. Unlike autoregressive language models (LLMs) that intertwine syntax, semantics, and sequential prediction into a token-by-token generation pipeline, Sterling begins with symbolic, typed intermediate representations (IR) that encode deep structure, inference logic, and propositional semantics. This document formalizes a generative hypothesis: that diffusion-based language generation, especially when conditioned on semantic graphs, is better aligned with Sterling's architecture than traditional autoregressive decoding.

name: core_realization_theory_alignment.md
status: _foundation complete_ – a second domain (code refactoring) has been integrated on the same skeleton[Sterling](../../../docs/roadmaps/core_realization_roadmap.md#L176-L184). This demonstrates that the operator calculus and state model generalize beyond the initial linguistic domain. The theory’s promise that “multiple domains (PN, WordNet, text IR, code IR, etc.) run on the same engine” is being fulfilled[Sterling](../../../docs/roadmaps/core_realization_roadmap.md#L74-L81). Minor misalignments surfaced (e.g. slight differences in how certain operators manifested in the new domain), but these are being corrected[Sterling](../../../docs/roadmaps/core_realization_roadmap.md#L178-L186). **Research completeness:** High – domain transfer was a hypothesis now supported by evidence (Sterling has shown cross-domain competence in internal benchmarks[Sterling](../../../docs/roadmaps/core_realization_roadmap.md#L21-L28)). **Production readiness:** Medium – while the core engine needed only small fixes for the new domain (e.g. handling code syntax vs. natural language)[Sterling](../../../docs/roadmaps/core_realization_roadmap.md#L178-L186), further work is ongoing to expand test coverage and ensure refactoring tasks meet success criteria. No fundamental theory changes were required, indicating the design’s robustness.

name: P22_perceptual_substrate_and_visual_realization.md
description: P22 adds a governed, replayable perception and realization substrate. Perception and generation models can propose evidence or candidates, but only governed operators can mutate authoritative state or commit generated artifacts. - `sense(media, policy, detector) -> PerceptObservationIRv0` - `commit(observation, budgets) -> PerceptStateV1, PerceptDeltaIRv0` - `derive_render_intent(percept_state) -> RenderIntentV1` - `verify(render_intent, measurement_observation) -> VerificationReportV1` - `commit_rendered_asset(report, candidate_asset_hash) -> MediaAssetRefV1 | fail_closed` - Golden digest lock for capsule spec + canonical payloads.
recommendation: Active development - no action needed
